dxf2svg.svg
Class SvgDoubleEndedElementAggregate

java.lang.Object
  dxf2svg.svg.SvgElement
      dxf2svg.svg.SvgObject
          dxf2svg.svg.SvgGraphicElement
              dxf2svg.svg.SvgDoubleEndedElementAggregate
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class SvgDoubleEndedElementAggregate
extends SvgGraphicElement

This class takes SvgDoubleEndedElements and combines their pathing attributes into one continuous path description. This is required to accomodate animation that must be applied to a group of element but whose javascript event target would be individual pieces. Consider a wire run in a schematic that needs to turn red when the user clicks the wire. With animation the group will react together onmouseover, however when you need to click the object to change the colour the event is fired for the element that was directly under the mouse when the the click event took place and not the group of elements that is formed by the <g> tag.

Doing this also makes the elements simpler and takes up less space.

At the current time the only client of this class is AnimationEngine exclusively. It is also required only for item for wire runs.

How do we apply specific

Version:
0.01 - September 1, 2004
Author:
Andrew Nisbet

Constructor Detail

SvgDoubleEndedElementAggregate

public SvgDoubleEndedElementAggregate(DxfConverter dxfc)
Method Detail

add

public void add(SvgDoubleEndedGraphicElement sd)
This method takes a SvgDoubleEndedElement and takes the display attributes of the first element submitted and copies them as its own. It is assumed that all the elements that are to be combined into this aggregation have the same display attributes because making elements with different attributes into a aggregate wouldn't make sense.

Next the path data is taken and assembled. together into one big <path> element.

getAttributes

protected java.lang.StringBuffer getAttributes()
This method overrides the super classes method to include functionality to determine which attributes, if any, differ from the layer that they came from in the dxf file.

There is a complex interaction of rules for expressing the correct array of attributes that any one SvgObject requires.

Overrides:
getAttributes in class SvgGraphicElement
Returns:
StringBuffer

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
This method returns the String version of this object, but the format is different from the other SvgElements in that the attributes must be output individually instead of together in the 'style' attribute. The reason for this is because the Adobe plugin's JavaScript engine will not allow style string attributes to be altered. Only descrete attributes can be altered.

Overrides:
toString in class SvgGraphicElement
Returns:
String Formatted Svg element.

addAnimation

public void addAnimation(java.util.Vector sas)
Allows the addition of multipule animations to an this class,

If the array of animation objects is null, or its length is less than 1, the method returns without altering the the class.

Throws:
java.lang.ClassCastException - if the Vector arg contains anything other than SvgAnimator objects.

Returns:
